Community centers, libraries, and other public spaces could be utilized to provide supervised learning environments for students.
Local businesses and organizations could offer volunteer-led education programs for students, including tutoring and mentorship.
Homeschooling or home-based education programs could be put in place to allow families to educate their children at home.
Mobile learning vehicles, such as buses or vans, could be utilized to offer educational programming to students in underserved areas.
Virtual reality and augmented reality technology could be used to create immersive educational experiences for students.
